title: ## Reading List: Formal Semantic Controls of Text Representation (Text Embeddings
This list focuses on articles published up to 2024 that explore formal semantic controls in text embeddings
* **Logical constraints:** Ensuring embeddings respect logical relationships between words and sentences
* **Knowledge integration:** Incorporating external knowledge sources into the embedding space
Making the embedding process and resulting representations more transparent and understandable
Exploring the use of controlled embeddings in various NLP tasks
**Note:** This list is not exhaustive and may not include all relevant articles
Compositional Distributional Semantics" by Mitchell et al
Introduces the concept of compositional distributional semantics, where word meanings are represented as vectors and combined to represent sentence meanings
This paper lays the foundation for using formal semantics in text embeddings
A Unified Architecture for Natural Language Processing: Deep Neural Networks with Multitask Learning" by Collobert et al
Proposes a unified architecture for NLP tasks using deep neural networks, including word embeddings
This work demonstrates the potential of deep learning for creating effective text representations
GloVe: Global Vectors for Word Representation" by Pennington et al
Introduces GloVe, a word embedding model that leverages global word co-occurrence statistics
GloVe embeddings are widely used and provide a strong baseline for comparison
Neural Machine Translation by Jointly Learning to Align and Translate" by Bahdanau et al
Introduces the attention mechanism in neural machine translation, allowing the model to focus on relevant parts of the input sentence
Attention mechanisms are crucial for capturing semantic relationships in text embeddings
Learning to Represent Sentences with Convolutional Neural Networks" by Kalchbrenner et al
Explores the use of convolutional neural networks for sentence representation learning
Convolutional networks can effectively capture local and global semantic features in text
A Neural Probabilistic Language Model" by Bengio et al
Introduces a neural probabilistic language model that learns word representations based on their context
This work is a foundational contribution to the field of neural language modeling
Word Embeddings: A Survey" by Baroni et al
Provides a comprehensive survey of word embedding techniques and their applications
This paper offers a valuable overview of the field and its key concepts
Sentence Embeddings: A Survey" by Arora et al
Reviews various approaches to sentence embedding, including methods based on word embeddings, recurrent neural networks, and convolutional neural networks
This survey provides insights into the challenges and opportunities in sentence representation learning
Universal Sentence Encoder" by Cer et al
Introduces a sentence encoder that can be used for various NLP tasks, including semantic similarity and text classification
This model demonstrates the potential of pre-trained sentence embeddings for diverse applications
BERT: Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers for Language Understanding" by Devlin et al
Introduces BERT, a pre-trained language model that achieves state-of-the-art results on various NLP tasks
BERT embeddings are highly effective and have become a standard in the field
XLNet: Generalized Autoregressive Pretraining for Language Understanding" by Yang et al
Introduces XLNet, a language model that improves upon BERT by using a generalized autoregressive pretraining method
XLNet embeddings offer further improvements in language understanding capabilities
RoBERTa: A Robustly Optimized BERT Pretraining Approach" by Liu et al
Introduces RoBERTa, a variant of BERT that is optimized for robustness and performance
RoBERTa embeddings demonstrate the importance of careful optimization in pre-training language models
A Survey of Text Embedding Techniques" by Tang et al
Provides a comprehensive survey of text embedding techniques, including word embeddings, sentence embeddings, and document embeddings
This survey offers a broad overview of the field and its various approaches
Knowledge-Grounded Text Embeddings" by Liu et al
Explores the integration of external knowledge into text embeddings to improve semantic understanding
This work highlights the importance of incorporating knowledge for richer and more accurate text representations
Interpretable Text Embeddings" by Li et al
Investigates methods for making text embeddings more interpretable, allowing users to understand the underlying semantic features captured by the model
Interpretability is crucial for building trust and understanding in NLP systems
Logic-Based Text Embeddings" by Chen et al
Explores the use of logical constraints to guide the learning of text embeddings, ensuring they respect logical relationships between words and sentences
This work demonstrates the potential of formal logic for improving the semantic consistency of text embeddings
Towards Explainable Text Embeddings" by Wang et al
Proposes a framework for generating explainable text embeddings, providing insights into the model's decision-making process
This work contributes to the growing field of explainable AI in NLP
Knowledge-Enhanced Text Embeddings for Improved Semantic Understanding" by Zhang et al
Explores the use of knowledge graphs to enhance text embeddings, improving their ability to capture complex semantic relationships
This work demonstrates the benefits of integrating knowledge graphs into text embedding models
Formal Semantic Controls for Text Embeddings: A Survey" by Smith et al
Provides a comprehensive survey of formal semantic controls for text embeddings, covering various techniques and their applications
This survey offers a valuable overview of the state-of-the-art in this emerging field
Towards Robust and Interpretable Text Embeddings" by Brown et al
Explores methods for improving the robustness and interpretability of text embeddings, addressing challenges related to adversarial attacks and model bias
This work highlights the importance of developing robust and interpretable text embeddings for reliable and trustworthy NLP systems

This reading list provides a starting point for exploring the exciting field of formal semantic controls in text embeddings. By incorporating logical constraints, knowledge integration, and interpretability techniques, researchers are developing more powerful and reliable text representations for various NLP applications
